intro: Cyathodes nitida, commonly known as the silky cyathodes, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences called cyathodes, which are typical of the genus. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth, almost silky texture, giving it its common name. The flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are often visited by small insects, contributing to its ecological role in pollination.
